boat.name: Fleetwing
boat.full_description:
Built in 1913, 'Fleetwing' is one of the oldest surviving Harrison Butler designed yachts. 'Memory' was built the year before, and 'Argo' the year after. 

She sailed on the Norfolk broads, then from 1934 sailed out of Dover making frequent Channel crossings before  WWII.

In 1976 she moved to Maylandsea on the river Blackwater, competing in the OGA's East Coast Race in 1979 and 1980. In 1980  she won the Boat World Trophy, for coming first in Class II.

Although of historical value she's had some difficult years recently, with a succession of owners taking her on, only to find she was “more of a project” than they initially realised. Paul Goold installed 'Fleetwing' under a tent in the Heritage Marine boatyard in Essex where work on her is progressing steadily; the floors have being re galvanised and are back in. A professional boat surveyor looked at her hull in November 2015 and came up with a schedule of work.
boat.short_description: 'Fleetwing' was the 2nd Harrison Butler Cruising yacht built, and the oldest now surviving. Although originally called 'Seagull', she had been renamed 'Fleetwing' only a year later, in 1914.
